overview_of_class:
This course is an introduction to signed numbers, equations, exponents, polynomials, factoring, graphing and geometry.

Recommended for students who would benefit from reviewing high school algebra. This course does not count for credit if taken after any higher mathematics course.
name: Algebra
title: SCS MATH 101-CN-65 Algebra

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This course is an introduction to signed numbers, equations, exponents, polynomials, factoring, graphing and geometry.

Recommended for students who would benefit from reviewing high school algebra. This course does not count for credit if taken after any higher mathematics course.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
A. Apply the properties of real numbers to integers and rational numbers.
B. Perform the fundamental operations with integers and rational numbers.
C. Perform the algebraic operations and factoring with polynomials.
D. Perform multiplication and division with rational expressions.
E. Solve first degree equations and inequalities in one variable.
F. Solve graph of first degree equations in two variables.
G. Solve systems of first degree equations in two variables.
H. Solve second degree equations in one variable by factoring

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Methods of instruction may include lecture, discussion, demonstration, group work, audio-visual aids and regularly assigned homework.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
This course will be considered completed if a minimum average of 60% has been achieved. Chapter test will be given and the final grade will be based on the average of the chapter tests.

Averages Grade
90-100 A
80-89 B
70-79 C
60-69 D
59-below F

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Texts may include the following. Visit the campus bookstore or its website to confirm materials for the course:

Intermediate Algebra, 11th Edition, Marvin L. Bittinger, Addison Wesley Publishing Co. ISBN 9780321613363

subject: MATH
